awd_titl_txt: Using Pyrolysis-GC-MS to Enhance Student's Knowledge of     Modern Instrumental Microanalytical Techniques and Methods  of Science Research
awd_abstract_narration: Minority and disadvantaged students are learning microanalysis theory           and techniques and modern scientific research methods.  Objectives              include: integrating a gas chromatograph - mass spectrometer - data             system (GC-MS) into a microscale organic laboratory; using GC-MS and            pyrolysis for an instrumental analysis course; and developing two novel         advanced courses on "Methods of Scientific Research."  Innovative               projects are being used in the use of antibodies for biochemical                analysis using pyrolysis GC-MS and the analysis of actual "crack"               samples by pyrolysis GC-MS.  Lab writeups and videotapes of the new             experiments and instrument use are being prepared.  Mastery of                  microanalytical techniques, research methods and computer skills is             increasing the successful program completion by these students.                                                                                                 The grantee is matching the award from non-Federal sources.

inst.inst_name: CUNY John Jay College of Criminal Justice
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
